string-array.name: sights_history
string-array.item: Right in the center of Barnaul on a granite pillar there stands a vase made of Korgon porphyry. The vase marks Barnauls Kilometre Zero. It is the origin point of all the roads of Altai Krai. The vase adds life to the place and gives the city its own special appeal. The height of the Kolyvan beauty is 2 meters, the weight – 1,200 kilos.\n The stone for the vase was extracted in the Korgon mine in 1815. It was not until 2003 that the vase was carved out of this stone. The pedestal is decorated with a mosaic made of black gabbro which depicts cardinal directions and twelve zodiac signs. The total size of the vase with the pedestal is six and a half meters.\n The Kilometre Zero is a popular spot for get-togethers and leisurely walks. People also come here to make a wish. The wish-making ritual takes three steps, first you find your own zodiac sign on the mosaic, then turn around three times and throw a coin. If you manage to throw your coin onto the lid of the vase, your wish will surely come true.

2013 marked the 170 anniversary of the Tsarina of Vases, a unique artwork of the Kolyvan masters which was made of green undulated Revnevo jasper. The height of the vase is 2,57m. The vase has an oval shape. Its maximum width is 5,04m, the minimum width is 3,22m. It is the biggest vase in the world. The vase is displayed in the State Hermitage Museum.\n In 2008 Kolyvan craftsmen ventured to make a similar vase. They cut out a replica of the Tsarina of Vases which was 5 times as small. The work on this vase continued for a year. Now it is located in the Ob Health Resort (Barnaul, Zmeinogorsky Trakt, 77).\n Replica of the Tsarina of Vases

К о л ы в а н с к а я в а з а ,
Since 1981 the Kolyvan vase installed in the Wedding Palace (Lenina Prospekt, 11) has imbued newly married couples with its positive energy. It contributes to a grandiose and solemn atmosphere of the ceremonial hall where newlyweds perform their first dance.

To make the stone come alive is a dream many masters have.A great contribution to the revival of the art of Florentine mosaic in Altai was made by the graduates of the I. Repin School of Art – Olga and Georgy Alekseev.\n Through their effort Barnaul acquired new Florentine mosaics of big size. One of the first pictures made in this technique is now displayed in the building of Barnaul Port (Ploshchad Bavarina, 8).).

The Barnaul Palace of Culture of the Motor Plant (Ulitsa Titova, 50-a) is decorated with three works of G. Alekseev under a common name The Youth of Altai (1987). Visit Barnaul and enjoy the beauty of its nature!.

Barnaul traces its history back to 1730. The city emerged in the outlying districts of the Russian Empire as a center of mining industry which provided silver, copper, lead and gold for the state treasury.
 The first monument that appeared in Barnaul is a granite pillar – the Demidov Obelisk. The foundation for the obelisk was laid on June 18, 1825 on the initiative of P.K. Frolov who was the head of the Kolyvano-Voskresensky works. The stones for the obelisk were transported to the city on floats down the rivers Charysh and Ob. The obelisk is 14 meters high.
 th The Demidov Obelisk is of special significance. It was erected in honor of the 100 anniversary of mining industry in Altai.
 With its elegant simplicity of line this most durable monument in the city still evokes admiration. Visitors still marvel at the unsurpassed quality of performance of Kolyvan artisans and at the beauty of the architecture.

In honor of the city of th Barnauls 250 anniversary in 1980 an amphora-form vase made of Revnevo jasper was installed in the square at the crossing of Pushkina Street and Lenina Prospekt. The stone has absorbed all the colors of nature.\n W h e n y o u f e e l downhearted come to enjoy the view of the jasper vase. Known as the stone of life jasper brings vitality and awakens a sense of joy

In honor of the 50 anniversary of Altai Krai a vase was placed at the crossing of Lenina Prospekt and Korolenko Street. The vase is made of Beloretsk quartzite and resembles a bowl which is filled with wishes of well-being and prosperity.\n Stone vases installed in the streets and squares of Barnaul are a true attraction of the city. Notice how elegantly and gracefully these vases complete the composition of the park.\n Depending on the season every vase changes its color. Such changes cannot be seen in a museum. Placed in the natural urban landscape and being so close to city dwellers, these treasures are beckoning.

In 2003 a sculpture made of undulated Revnevo jasper was installed in Barnaul Port not far from the Chapel of St. Vladimir in token of the memory of V.N. Bavarin, the first head of the local government of the city of Barnaul.\n The inscription written on the marble base on the back side of the pedestal says – The square is named after the head of the Barnaul City Administration Vladimir Nikolaevich Bavarin (1939-2003).\n The sculpture was carved out by Kolyvan masters in the form of a half-vase which symbolizes the tragic and untimely death of the city mayor.

Vases made by the Kolyvan masters can be seen in many places of Barnaul. They adorn Barnaul theaters, the Altai Krai State Philharmonic Hall, the Wedding Palace, Train Station, and other public buildings of Barnaul./n These vases are the true evidence that the Altai Mountains are still rich in semi-precious and precious stones. They prove that our land can be still proud of artisans of unique crafts who can bring life out of s tone . Through the i r t a l ent exclusively beautiful Altai jasper and porphyry acquire an individual touch as the old stone cutters said.\n The most famous modern vase, the Jubilee Vase, was made in th 2002 for the 200 anniversary of the Kolyvan Stonecutting Factory. A wonderful vase made in an unusual octahedral form was given as a gift to the Federation Council of the Federal Assembly of Russia./n In 2003 this vase was included into the collection of unsurpassed masterpieces of th Kolyvan craftsmen of the 19 century in the State Hermitage Museum. A replica of the Jubilee Vase is installed in the V.M. Shukshin State Drama Theatre of Altai.

Altai stones are very beautiful and they are also very hard. Stone density is 7 units. Color patterns of a rock are determined by the environments of mineral deposits and the geological processes which occurred there 400 years ago.\n Stones for art works come in a great variety of hues and this fact speaks best for the wealth of color of Altais nature..
The picture glorifying the nature of Altai decorates the V.M. Shukshin State Drama Theatre of Altai (Ulitsa Molodezhnaya, 15)

Icons made in the style of Florentine mosaic are really impressive.\n One of such icons can be seen in St. Nicholas Church (Lenina Prospekt, 36).\n This icon was installed in 2002 in the inner courtyard on the side of the altar.
The biggest Florentine mosaic picture can be seen in the hall of the main building of Altai State Medical University. The picture was installed in 1994 to mark the 40 anniversary of the university.
The four medallions Nature of Altai Design – A. Bitter The swimming pool of the Ob Health Resort
